maml:description.maml:para: Register Transmission credentials for the session. Required before running any Transmission cmdlets.
Register Transmission credentials for the session. Required before running any Transmission cmdlets.
Optionally store credentials permanently in an encrypted locally stored file to remove the need for credentials to be set in each session by supplying the StorePermanent switch parameter.
The URL of your Transmission API instance, which will look something like: http://192.168.0.1:9091/transmission/rpc
The Host is only validated to be a non-empty string, so please ensure you enter the URL correctly.
The user name used to login to your Transmission instance, if applicable.
The password used to login to your Transmission instance, if applicable.
If supplied credentials will be stored permanently in an encrypted local file that removes the need for credentials to be set in each session.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Register credentials in session

dev:remarks.maml:para: Credentials will be registered for the lifetime of the session.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Register credentials in session and store permanently

dev:remarks.maml:para: Credentials will be registered for the lifetime of the session and stored locally so that this command will not need to be run again.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove previously registered Transmission credentials.
Remove previously registered Transmission credentials for the session.
Optionally remove stored credentials from an encrypted local file by supplying the DeletePermanent switch parameter.
If supplied any credentials stored permanently in an encrypted local file will be deleted.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove previously registered credentials from session

dev:remarks.maml:para: Previously registered credentials will be removed.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove previously registered credentials from session and those stored locally

dev:remarks.maml:para: Previously registered credentials will be removed from the session and from the encrypted local file.

maml:description.maml:para: Tells the Transmission session to shut down.
Tells the Transmission session to shut down.
Calls the 'session-close' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Once shut down there is no way to restart Transmission via the API.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Shut down Transmission

dev:remarks.maml:para: Transmission will be shut down.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Transmission session information.
Gets Transmission session information.
Calls the 'session-get' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
If supplied the data will be output as a JSON string.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get session information

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the session information.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get session information as JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the session information as a JSON string.

maml:description.maml:para: Set Transmission alt speed state.
Set Transmission alt speed state.
Calls the 'session-set' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Enable alt speed limits.
Disable alt speed limits.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Enable the alt speed limit

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enable the alt speed limit.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Disable the alt speed limit

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disable the alt speed limit.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets Transmission session configuration.
Sets Transmission session configuration.
Calls the 'session-set' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Max global download speed (KBps)
True means use the alt speeds
When to turn on alt speeds (units: minutes after midnight)
True means the scheduled on/off times are used
When to turn off alt speeds (units: minutes after midnight)
What day(s) to turn on alt speeds
Max global upload speed (KBps)
Location of the blocklist to use for "blocklist-update"
True means enabled
Maximum size of the disk cache (MB)
Default path to download torrents
Max number of torrents to download at once (see download-queue-enabled)
If true, limit how many torrents can be downloaded at once
True means allow dht in public torrents
"required", "preferred", "tolerated"
Torrents we're seeding will be stopped if they're idle for this long
True if the seeding inactivity limit is honored by default
Path for incomplete torrents, when enabled
True means keep torrents in incomplete-dir until done
True means allow Local Peer Discovery in public torrents
Maximum global number of peers
Maximum global number of peers
True means allow pex in public torrents
Port number
True means pick a random peer port on launch
true means enabled
Whether or not to consider idle torrents as stalled
Torrents that are idle for N minuets aren't counted toward seed-queue-size or download-queue-size
True means append ".part" to incomplete files
Filename of the script to run
Whether or not to call the "done" script
The default seed ratio for torrents to use
True if seedRatioLimit is honored by default
Max number of torrents to uploaded at once (see seed-queue-enabled)
If true, limit how many torrents can be uploaded at once
Max global download speed (KBps)
True means enabled
max global upload speed (KBps)
True means enabled
True means added torrents will be started right away
True means the .torrent file of added torrents will be deleted
True means allow utp

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Enable the alt speed limit

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enable the alt speed limit.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Enable the alt speed scheduler, set scheduled time as 22:00 to 07:00 and download speed as 3Mb

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enable the alt speed scheduler, set scheduled time as 22:00 to 07:00 and download speed as 3Mb.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Transmission session statistics.
Gets Transmission session statistics.
Calls the 'session-stats' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
If supplied the data will be output as a JSON string.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get session statistics

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the session statistics.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get session statistics as JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the session statistics as a JSON string.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests to see if your incoming peer port is accessible from the outside world.
Tests to see if your incoming peer port is accessible from the outside world.
Calls the 'port-test' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test port

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test port and return a success message or throw a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Test port and return a boolean

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test port and return a boolean.

maml:description.maml:para: Opens the transmission web UI in the default system browser.
Opens the transmission web UI in the default system browser.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Open web UI

dev:remarks.maml:para: Transmission web UI is opened in the system default browser.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates blocklists.
Updates blocklists.
Calls the 'blocklist-update' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update blocklists

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update blocklists and return a success message or throw a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Update blocklists and return a boolean

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update blocklists and return a boolean.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds torrents to Transmission.
Adds torrents to Transmission. Add via URL (i.e. magnet link), .torrent file or base64 encoded .torrent content.
One of the following parameters must be supplied: Urls, Files or MetaInfos.
If multiple torrents are supplied, then NONE of the following parameters should be supplied: FilesWanted, FilesUnwanted, PriorityHigh, PriorityLow, PriorityNormal.
Calls the 'torrent-add' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of URLs.
Array of .torrent files.
Array of base64 encoded .torrent content.

Pointer to a string of one or more cookies. The format should be NAME=CONTENTS, where NAME is the cookie name and CONTENTS is what the cookie should contain. Set multiple cookies like this: "name1=content1; name2=content2;" etc.
Path to download the torrent to.
If true, don't start the torrent.
Maximum number of peers.
Torrent's bandwidth priority.
Indices of file(s) to download.
Indices of file(s) to not download.
Indices of high priority file(s).
Indices of low priority file(s).
Indices of normal priority file(s).
If supplied the data will be output as a JSON string.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add torrent from magnet link

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the torrent to Transmission.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add torrent from pipeline, pause download and get response as JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the torrent to Transmission, pauses download and returns response as JSON.

maml:description.maml:para: Verify torrents.
Verify torrents.
Calls the 'torrent-verify' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Verify torrents and return a success message or throw a terminating error

dev:remarks.maml:para: Verifies torrents and returns a success message or throws a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Verify torrents using pipeline and return a boolean

dev:remarks.maml:para: Verifies torrents and returns a boolean.

maml:description.maml:para: Get torrents.

Get torrents. If no torrent ids are supplied then all torrents will be returned. Alternatively the Completed and Incomplete switch parameters will return torrents that have finished downloading or are still downloading (based on download percent).
Calls the 'torrent-get' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied all completed torrents will be retrieved.
If supplied all in progress torrents will be retrieved.
If supplied the data will be output as a JSON string.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get all completed torrents and return as JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all completed torrents and returns as JSON.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get torrents by id using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all torrents with ids 1 and 2.

maml:description.maml:para: Re-announce torrents (i.e. ask tracker for more peers).
Re-announce torrents (i.e. ask tracker for more peers).
Calls the 'torrent-reannounce' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Re-announce torrents and return a success message or throw a terminating error

dev:remarks.maml:para: Re-announces torrents and returns a success message or throws a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Re-announce torrents using pipeline and return a boolean

dev:remarks.maml:para: Re-announces torrents and returns a boolean.

maml:description.maml:para: Move torrents in the queue.
Move torrents in the queue.
One of the following parameters needs to be supplied alongside the TorrentIds parameter: Up, Down, Top, Bottom.
Calls the 'queue-move-top', 'queue-move-up', 'queue-move-down' and 'queue-move-bottom' endpoints: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied the torrent(s) will be moved up the queue.
If supplied the torrent(s) will be moved down the queue.
If supplied the torrent(s) will be moved to the top of the queue.
If supplied the torrent(s) will be moved to the bottom of the queue.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Move torrent up the queue

dev:remarks.maml:para: Torrent is moved up the queue.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Move torrents to the bottom of the queue using pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Torrents are moved to the bottom of the queue.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove torrents.
Remove torrents. The All, Completed and Incomplete switch parameters will return all torrents, torrents that have finished downloading or are still downloading (based on download percent).
If the DeleteData switch is supplied then any local data will be deleted when the torrent is removed.
Calls the 'torrent-remove' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied all torrents will be removed.
If supplied all completed torrents will be removed.
If supplied all in progress torrents will be removed.
If supplied any local data will also be deleted when removing the torrent.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove all torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove all completed torrents and delete local data

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all completed torrents and deletes local data.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Remove torrents by id using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all torrents with ids 1 and 2.

maml:description.maml:para: Rename a torrent's path.
Rename a torrent's path.

For more information on the use of this function, see the transmission.h documentation of tr_torrentRenamePath(). In particular, note that if this call succeeds you'll want to update the torrent's "files" and "name" field with torrent-get.
Calls the 'torrent-rename-path' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Torrent id.
Torrent path.
Torrent name.
If supplied the data will be output as a JSON string.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Rename torrent path

dev:remarks.maml:para: Rename torrent path.

maml:description.maml:para: Update torrent.
Update torrent.
Calls the 'torrent-set' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
Torrent's bandwidth priority.
Maximum download speed (KBps).
Download limit is honoured.
Session upload limits are honoured.
New location of the torrent's content.
Maximum number of peers.
Position of this torrent in its queue [0...n).
Torrent-level number of minutes of seeding inactivity.
Which seeding inactivity to use.
Torrent-level seeding ratio.
Which ratio to use.
Maximum upload speed (KBps).
Upload limit is honoured.
Strings of announce URLs to add.
Ids of trackers to remove.
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update torrent upload limit to 500 KBps

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the torrent's upload limit to 500 KBps.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Update torrent upload limit to 500 KBps from pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the torrent's upload limit to 500 KBps.

maml:description.maml:para: Move a torrent.
Move a torrent.
Calls the 'torrent-set-location' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
New torrent location.
If supplied move torrent from previous location, otherwise search "location" for files.
If supplied the response will be a boolean, otherwise a success message or a terminating error.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set torrent location

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the torrent's location.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set torrent location from pipeline, move from previous location and return results as a bool

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the torrent's location and moves from previous location.

maml:description.maml:para: Start torrents.
Start torrents. The All, Completed and Incomplete switch parameters will return all torrents, torrents that have finished downloading or are still downloading (based on download percent).
Calls the 'torrent-start' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied all torrents will be started.
If supplied all completed torrents will be started.
If supplied all in progress torrents will be started.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Start all torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Start all completed torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all completed torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Start torrents by id using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all torrents with ids 1 and 2.

maml:description.maml:para: Start torrents now.
Start torrents now. 'start now' differs from 'start' because it forces torrents to start even if they're queued.
The All, Completed and Incomplete switch parameters will return all torrents, torrents that have finished downloading or are still downloading (based on download percent).
Calls the 'torrent-start-now' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied all torrents will be started.
If supplied all completed torrents will be started.
If supplied all in progress torrents will be started.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Start all torrents now

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all torrents now.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Start all completed torrents now

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all completed torrents now.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Start torrents now by id using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts all torrents with ids 1 and 2 now.

maml:description.maml:para: Stop torrents.
Stop torrents. The All, Completed and Incomplete switch parameters will return all torrents, torrents that have finished downloading or are still downloading (based on download percent).
Calls the 'torrent-stop' endpoint: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/blob/master/extras/rpc-spec.txt
Array of torrent ids.
If supplied all torrents will be stopped.
If supplied all completed torrents will be stopped.
If supplied all in progress torrents will be stopped.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Stop all torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stops all torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Stop all completed torrents

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stops all completed torrents.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Stop torrents by id using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stops all torrents with ids 1 and 2.
